newsitem.title: TUNISIA: Airline Tunis Air raises capital.
newsitem.headline: Airline Tunis Air raises capital.

text.p: Tunisian flag carrier Tunis Air will raise its capital by 5.3 million dinars ($4.8 million) to 58.3 million dinars from 53 million dinars, officials at the company said on Thursday.
The rise was by incorporation of amounts coming from a company's special investment account and from its special saving fund.
Current shareholders will receive one free share worth five dinars for each 10 old shares.
The decision to rise the capital was approved by the company's annual meeting held on Wednesday. It will take effect on July 1st.
The company's capital and total reserves amounted to 392.08 million dinars at end of 1996.

The Tunisian state and public funds were the main sharehoders in the capital of Tunis Air. Air France has a 5.6 percent stake. The company in 1995 sold 20 percent of its capital in the biggest privatisation in the country so far, for an amount of 32 million dinars.
